intro: Monnina macrosepala, commonly known as the large-sepaled monnina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that disperses seeds through wind, contributing to its ecological role in its native environment.
